page.title: 02Crouch Hill :Banbury
page.content: Crouch Hill is the {highest point in the Banbury district}. It is now used for crops except for rough grass and bushes at the top. During World War II they used Crouch Hill as an {air raid lookout post}. In 400 BC there was a {British settlement}. There is no evidence that the Romans settled in Banbury because there are no coins or anything to prove it. The hill is very popular with children because they like sledging there in the winter. There is a public footpath that goes down the hill. The shape of the is a hill kind of dome shape. Every Christmas, the {Scouts walk 40 miles} and go to the top where there is a {bench mark}. Stuart Smith
